taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek tri , 3-fold, and phoros , bearing, possibly in reference to the few-flowered inflorescence or the 3 crests on the lip of the type species]

bio:treatment.discussion: Most species of Triphora exist in small, scattered populations and exhibit synchronous, ephemeral flowering; flowers last only one day. Synchrony enhances the chances for fertilization. Isolated flowers are rarely fertilized.
